title: These IKEA Picks Are the Perfect Recipe for a Playful, Cheery Kitchen
description: Did you know the average American spends a staggering 1,000 hours per year in their kitchen, according to a recent survey by OnePoll? It’s certainly true for our household. On any given day, we spent many hours in the kitchen — using it as an art studio, conversation space, classroom, and everything in between. IKEA gets this. They understand a kitchen is so much more than just a place to cook. And kitchenware should not only be practical but also […] The post These IKEA Picks Are the Perfect Recipe for a Playful, Cheery Kitchen appeared first on IKEA Hackers.
author: Stacy Randall
excerpt: The newly added IKEA kitchenware collection does exactly that. Picture timeless, clean lines with a playful twist—familiar favorites reimagined with bold, unexpected colors and a sense of whimsy that sparks happiness.
text: Did you know the average American spends a staggering 1,000 hours per year in their kitchen, according to a recent survey by OnePoll? It’s certainly true for our household. On any given day, we spent many hours in the kitchen — using it as an art studio, conversation space, classroom, and everything in between. IKEA gets this. They understand a kitchen is so much more than just a place to cook. And kitchenware should not only be practical but also infuse the space with joy, add a splash of color, and bring a smile to your face. Their newly added kitchenware collection does exactly that. Picture timeless, clean lines with a playful twist—familiar favorites reimagined with bold, unexpected colors and a sense of whimsy that sparks happiness. We’ve picked out the pieces that catch our eye and promise to make the kitchen a bold, cheerful zone—transforming the busiest room in the house into a space that’s as vibrant and dynamic as the life we live in it. IKEA Kitchenware: Fresh Designs for Spring Photo Credit: SLÖJSTJÄRT Paper Napkins | IKEA.com Paper napkins are commonplace in the average kitchen, making everyday use a breeze since you don’t need to wash them. I can’t tell you the last time I used cloth napkins. However, most of the time, you probably use ordinary, boring white napkins unless you’re celebrating a special occasion. Well, it’s time to put boring on the back burner, because IKEA’s new SLÖJSTJÄRT napkins turn a run-of-the-mill kitchen staple into a cute and colorful accent. There are several styles and sizes available, giving you a few options when it comes to crafting a cheery tablescape. The playful colors pop and make you smile, so much that it’s almost a shame to wipe your hands. Photo Credit: FÄRGKLAR Bowls | IKEA.com The spirited hues sync well with IKEA’s dependable FÄRGKLAR bowls, especially the matte turquoise and green picks. A glossy beige finish adds some extra shine, or mix-and-match to create a table that’s unapologetically you. Photo Credit: SLÖJSTJÄRT Tray | IKEA.com The concept of taking something so basic and making it a highlight in your kitchen goes hand-in-hand with IKEA’s push to add a fresh take to streamlined, Scandi style. But the whimsical touches don’t stop with napkins. The SLÖJSTJÄRT series also features a new patterned tray, napkin holder, and precious gingham tablecloth. (Although the tablecloth could use a few more patterns and colors — maybe they’re in the works? I hope so!) More Opportunities for Color in the Kitchen Photo Credit: IKEA.com Something IKEA celebrates this Spring is giving old products a new look. The GRADVIS vase, already available in a sweet pink, now comes in a dark gray. You might think dark gray doesn’t sound like a way to add color, but I think about the brilliant contrast once you fill it with beautiful, bright flowers and fresh greenery. Photo Credit: SOJABÖNA Plant Pot | IKEA.com The same goes for the brand-new SOJABÖNA Plant Pot, sporting a subtle gray-green. But if you’re looking for more color, the GRADVIS series also features a vivid blue-turquoise plant pot, begging for a bright bunch of yellow daisies. (And while we’re on the subject of giving old products a new look, check out how to turn the GRADVIS into a tissue holder.) Dress Up Your Kitchen Walls Photo Credit: PJÄTTERYD Canvas Prints | IKEA.com Another popular design trend that’s seen a lot of action lately is putting art in the kitchen. I admit that a little art does brighten up the room. I have a couple of pieces in my kitchen (framed and protected under glass). IKEA recently released the PJÄTTERYD canvas prints, which certainly contribute to a cheerful environment. I just wouldn’t hang them too close to the main meal prep action to keep them safe from moisture, grease splatters, and the like. Prepare and Serve a Welcoming Kitchen With Playful Touches SKUGGSTUBB mug | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Are your eyes starting to move fervently around your kitchen yet, wondering where to begin? A few colorful touches and making even the simplest things fun and beautiful is a winning recipe. Once you’re finished in the kitchen, consider how to refresh your bedroom with IKEA’s kaleidoscope of textiles and decor. Until then, set the table, serve your favorite meal, and enjoy good company in the heart of your home (maybe with a cute little napkin on your lap).
html:
Did you know the average American spends a staggering 1,000 hours per year in their kitchen, according to a recent survey by OnePoll?

It’s certainly true for our household. On any given day, we spent many hours in the kitchen — using it as an art studio, conversation space, classroom, and everything in between.

IKEA gets this.

They understand a kitchen is so much more than just a place to cook. And kitchenware should not only be practical but also infuse the space with joy, add a splash of color, and bring a smile to your face.

Their newly added kitchenware collection does exactly that. Picture timeless, clean lines with a playful twist—familiar favorites reimagined with bold, unexpected colors and a sense of whimsy that sparks happiness.

We’ve picked out the pieces that catch our eye and promise to make the kitchen a bold, cheerful zone—transforming the busiest room in the house into a space that’s as vibrant and dynamic as the life we live in it.

IKEA Kitchenware: Fresh Designs for Spring

Paper napkins are commonplace in the average kitchen, making everyday use a breeze since you don’t need to wash them. I can’t tell you the last time I used cloth napkins. However, most of the time, you probably use ordinary, boring white napkins unless you’re celebrating a special occasion.

Well, it’s time to put boring on the back burner, because IKEA’s new SLÖJSTJÄRT napkins turn a run-of-the-mill kitchen staple into a cute and colorful accent.

There are several styles and sizes available, giving you a few options when it comes to crafting a cheery tablescape. The playful colors pop and make you smile, so much that it’s almost a shame to wipe your hands.

The spirited hues sync well with IKEA’s dependable FÄRGKLAR bowls, especially the matte turquoise and green picks. A glossy beige finish adds some extra shine, or mix-and-match to create a table that’s unapologetically you.

The concept of taking something so basic and making it a highlight in your kitchen goes hand-in-hand with IKEA’s push to add a fresh take to streamlined, Scandi style. But the whimsical touches don’t stop with napkins.

The SLÖJSTJÄRT series also features a new patterned tray, napkin holder, and precious gingham tablecloth. (Although the tablecloth could use a few more patterns and colors — maybe they’re in the works? I hope so!)

More Opportunities for Color in the Kitchen

Something IKEA celebrates this Spring is giving old products a new look. The GRADVIS vase, already available in a sweet pink, now comes in a dark gray. You might think dark gray doesn’t sound like a way to add color, but I think about the brilliant contrast once you fill it with beautiful, bright flowers and fresh greenery.

The same goes for the brand-new SOJABÖNA Plant Pot, sporting a subtle gray-green. But if you’re looking for more color, the GRADVIS series also features a vivid blue-turquoise plant pot, begging for a bright bunch of yellow daisies. (And while we’re on the subject of giving old products a new look, check out how to turn the GRADVIS into a tissue holder.)

Dress Up Your Kitchen Walls

Another popular design trend that’s seen a lot of action lately is putting art in the kitchen. I admit that a little art does brighten up the room. I have a couple of pieces in my kitchen (framed and protected under glass).

IKEA recently released the PJÄTTERYD canvas prints, which certainly contribute to a cheerful environment. I just wouldn’t hang them too close to the main meal prep action to keep them safe from moisture, grease splatters, and the like.

Prepare and Serve a Welcoming Kitchen With Playful Touches

Are your eyes starting to move fervently around your kitchen yet, wondering where to begin? A few colorful touches and making even the simplest things fun and beautiful is a winning recipe.

Once you’re finished in the kitchen, consider how to refresh your bedroom with IKEA’s kaleidoscope of textiles and decor. Until then, set the table, serve your favorite meal, and enjoy good company in the heart of your home (maybe with a cute little napkin on your lap).
